Thank you, very well produced video. Much comes to mind, including a basic observation I had 30 years ago or so. It seems at almost everything, no matter how big or small (i.e., atomic or galactic), behaves in either a cyclic or rhythmic way. Many energy waves, as they travel through space (sound, radio, light, etc.) are rhythmic. I'm not formally well educated on much of this stuff, so don't know if there are some energies that travel in a straight line. Anyone who knows, feel free to comment. Your vid emphasized synchronization between a broad variety of individuals in a group. But it seems almost everything in the universe has its own established rhythm, which might be the same phenomenon, only with the subcomponents within an individual. An individual sound wave can only exist ("survive") if it's regular. If the crests (correct term for the outer limit of the wave?) of a wave changes, one of its primary defining characteristics (other than still being defined as sound) changes. IOW, it becomes something distinctly different from its former self. I'm just thinking this out real time as I write, so I may be off, but inspired (by your vid). Which I believe presented itself visually at 30 or so FPS via the laptop screen.

When I was a kid, I noticed that water flowing from our garden hose down the sloped concrete of our driveway, formed waves. The concrete was (relatively) smooth, surely with no such similar wave pattern on it, so the waves formation was obviously attributable to some other element of fluid dynamics, I believe it's called. While knowing specifically why waves form would be nice, it was mostly the observation that they formed period that had me start to see how almost everything (if not literally everything) is rhythmic/cyclic. And if we don't think it is, maybe it's only because of our lives are a nanosecond on the universe's time scale. That, or some other element of our limited capacities to perceive, that have us physically unable to detect the cycle

In astrophysics, the collective opinion among those in the field might be that 13.6 or so billion years ago, there was a mega-monster sized ball...just hanging out. You know, as it had for all of eternity until that point. Okay, so that's impossible, for one thing. Existence of anything, even empty space is impossible. It's impossible that that phat mega ball of matter was simply "always there". Something had to create it. It's impossible that there was ever a beginning. While I have a personal, experienced-based belief in a higher power I call God (for convenience), He/It is no exception. It's impossible that God, if there is one (I respect that my beliefs are not facts), has always been. Popular religion doesn't explain their conception of God. Saying "He's always been", or whatever is claimed, doesn't explain anything. It's just a way of moving on from that which can't be explained. So God, time, space, and all matter (and anti-matter), as I see, could never have the power to create itself from pure nothingness (meaning not even space, entirely void of even the small subatomic particle, exists). God...sorry, but while certain life experiences and "feelings" (the kind of feeling that...feels, or senses) have me believe you may be lurkin', I can't believe you created yourself. You might be omnipotent, but that'd only be after the fact. It'd impossible to for you to even have the thought "Hey, I want to exist" if you don't yet.

Okay, so we've established that it's impossible for anything, including empty space to exist. With that in mind, the purely confident statement of truth I believe is entirely accurate, is: Something's going on.

Moving on from that, since there's so much evidence that everything adheres to a cycle, then the universe must as well. I believe astrophysicists' popular theory is that the universe is expanding. If so, then I'd guess that expansion is only one phase of its cycle. It either expands so much it reconvenes on the other side of infinite space, or some other cosmic phenomenon causes it to eventually reverse from expanding to contracting, eventually causing it to all collect again, via the mega-ultra-as-big-as-the universe-plus-some, super duper massive black hole, which gets us back to that same phat and jiggly ball. Which in turn, probably hangs in that state for a few, until it gets either bored and/or antsy, increasing its baseline jigglyness, until it gets a hot under the collar (I might get a hair ticked off too if I was just floating in the middle of nowhere, for like 80 octillion years), heats up, causing all the atomic friction we like so much, until it just can't take it no more, and...BAM. You might see where I'm headed here.

So, I submit, that everything, every element of existence, even mental (the guy with the headphones mentioned something about psychological processes...or something cognitive processes based) doesn't merely "acquire" a cycle, as the result of its existence. I propose that it may be the foundation or the source or precursor to its existence.

Mike Myers (Austin Powers), who was once an SNL cast member, played a Scottish merchant character. In the skit he would say, "If it's not Scottish, it's CRAP!". I'm pretty darn close to feeling the same way about a cyclic precursor or foundational matrix being the only thing that matters...everything else (except maybe Scottish made materials and consumer products)...is CRAP!

Okay, I kind of lost there for a minute, but don't blame me. The vid did it. It inspired free thinking and that can happen. In fact, while I haven't done a formal trend analysis, it might happen at regular intervals. Even if they were irregular intervals, they're still intervals. And again, we might just need to pull back a half a hair more, and like displayed depiction of a beating heart, it's a regular rhythm, it has unique patterns, peaks, blips an' stuff...within each beat cycle. So maybe my aforementioned loss of sanity is just as essential as the Yin is to the Yang. One defines the other. Insanity is defined by its opposite. That's kiiind of another subject, but I would like to say, if you'll permit me, that maybe I wasn't speaking pure gibberish when speaking of the impossibility of anything. 'Cause let's face it. For anything to exist, it has to also not exist. IOW, if the entire universe was "chair", and there was nothing else, we wouldn't really thinking straight if we called the only thing that exists "chair" (the thing we humans invented to sit on). It's the fact that a chair doesn't exist that allows it to exist. Sense exists only because nonsense exists. And it might get interesting here: Space might only be able to exist if it also doesn't exist. As I said...my base concrete statement containing what I believe to be the highest definition of the word "fact", is that...something's going on.

It's no new theory that maybe nothing exists outside my mind. My mind and cognitive thought processes might have created the whole of the universe. Or...I might just be dreaming. Hey...when I hit they hay at night and dream, with only one exception, I don't even consider that I'm dreaming during the dream. The dream is just life. But when I wake up, it's...oh, I was dreaming, and am so convinced I've awoken to actual life, I don't often consider it to be anything else. But with the understanding that obviously our minds are sophisticated enough to create what we perceive as "reality", so well that we don't even suspect differently, then that A) says a lot about our mind's capacity to fool us, time and time again, and B) Has us consider that what we think of as "life" might be just another level of dream state. It could be when we "die", we simply return to a state of being that doesn't surprise us in the slightest...just like we're not surprised when waking from a nightly dream.

Which brings me to the psychological mention of the gentlemen with headphones. It supports a consideration that I've had for many years. That A) Reincarnation, may a thing. or B) Not so much reincarnation, but whatever's responsible for me consciously living this life, perceived internally. IOW, I sometimes wonder why the world isn't exactly the way it is, only me (Terry), am not experiencing Terry's life from his internal perspective. I wasn't any of the uncountable people who lived in the past (to my recollection, at least), so what is it that's attributable for me consciously living and looking out past these eyeballs at life, from the inside? Since that question's not easy to answer, I'd like to conclude with another proposal. Since my internal perception of Terry's life is the basis for my only confident pure truth statement, that something's going on, it's not too much of a stretch to consider that...if this internal conscious perception of Terry's life has definitely occurred, why might it not happen again? I don't know much about a soul or spirit that came from and returns to some afterlife homebase. So I'm not saying my consideration is based on that. I'm only saying...since it's happening now, with this conscious experience of life and the awareness that I'm aware of it (well said, I know), then simply based on the logic that since it's proven that it can and does happen, then...according to the universal laws of probability, might be somewhere between likely and guaranteed to happen...again.

The phenomenon of synchronization is a fundamental law in the universe, a law I call 'the law of embodiment'.  It states that if a system is capable of maintaining an ordered state as readily as it is capable of maintaining a disordered state, then that system will spontaneously move to the ordered state.  What's going on here?  Conscious embodiment.  The 'subjective' component of consciousness - it's conscious essence - is present everywhere, all the time, as an unchanging, constant field.  When a physical system spontaneously appears capable of pumping entropy out of its body, the flow of entropy out of that body is experienced by the system as awareness of the objective world. The system then continues the process spontaneously, driven by the primary intent of the system - to stay alive.  The only reason that synchronizing  metronomes aren't displaying more signs of life is because they don't have a body that can. Hi Derek, you made one false claim in this video. The audience clapping was not as you thought. In classical music concerts, when the soloist leaves the stage, the audience may be clapping  for appreciation, but if they wish to hear an encour piece, the audience will start a unison clap which slowly increases in speed. They will do this again and again, until the performer reappears on the stage, either for another bow or another short performance. That is what was happening when the audience began to syncronize their clapping. It was a conscious choice.

Synchronisation on a bridge is applying force/enhancing the strength of gravity simultaneously among all people walking on the bridge, if synchronously done so. This means excess pressure is applied to all parts of it. Meanwhile normally walking means pressure is applied at different timings and not simultaneously; this reduces the amount of force exerted atop the bridge drastically as if everyone's steps never occurred synchronously (i.e. everyone takes a step at a different timing from one another), then the bridge surface would only have to tolerate the weight of one person on the bridge at any given time of day provided it is open and has people walking on it.

Of course, reality is never like this where no two people walk the Earth stepping concurrently. But even if some hit the ground at the same time as another individual on the same bridge, it would not cause nearly as much force to be exerted upon the bridge every second as if all walkers were moving synchronously.

“And the earth We spread out, and placed therein firm mountains”

[al-Hijr 15:19]

“And We have placed on the earth firm mountains, lest it should shake with them”

[al-Anbiya’ 21:31]

“Have We not made the earth as a bed,

And the mountains as pegs?”

[an-Naba’ 78:6-7]

“And the mountains He has fixed firmly”

[an-Naazi‘aat 79:32]. 

The description of the mountains as “firm” and the statement that Allah, may He be exalted, “fixed them firmly” means that they are stable. This is reflected by the meaning of the root of these words in Arabic.

See: al-Qaamoos al- Muheet (p. 1662); Lisaan al-‘Arab (14/321) 

This idea of the mountains being firmly fixed is not denied by geology. Geological research proves that the mountains are fixed firmly in the earth and that they stabilise the earth. The roots of the mountains beneath the surface of the earth are several times deeper than the height of that which appears above the surface. 

Hence Allah, may He be exalted, stated that He made the mountains pegs, and the part of the peg that is driven into the ground is longer than the part that remains above it. That is what gives it greater strength so that it can hold firm the ropes of the tent. 

With regard to what geology says about the mountains moving horizontally a few millimetres every year, and that they are moving vertically, increasing or decreasing in height by a few millimetres every year, these are theories that do not contradict the description of the mountains as being stable and fixed, because it is a very slight movement that cannot be noted except by means of very precise instruments, and the effects of that movement appears after millions of years. 

That is what they say, and Allah knows best how true it is; there is no reference to that in the apparent meanings of the Qur’an.

It's not that hard: the 2nd law of thermodynamics does not require a specific time horizon to achieve disorder. Things can become more ordered to achieve a temporary lower energy state, and they do all the time (e.g. your watch's second hand, or freezing ice-cubes). It's the 'long term' over which the 2nd law applies. It's a common confusion over the 2nd law that things must tend to disorder all the time: of course they don't, or we'd never have life for starters. That's it in 10 seconds.

Why do pop science things insist on defining the second law of thermodynamics as "the universe tends towards disorder". This isn't what it says and whilst it is a valid potential phrasing, it requires understanding the strictly scientific definition of disorder, which no layman does (and even then it's annoyingly vague). And then said pop science thing goes ahead and uses it without regard to the scientific definition of disorder anyway.

It's an incredibly terrible way of presenting the law to the public, it might sound catchy and give you a nice segway to whatever you want to talk about but it also leads to mass misunderstanding of what the second law of thermodynamics is about (despite it being right there in the name).

Entropy is NOT the ‘tendency towards disorder’.  That characterization was debunked within months of its coining.  But its pithy and the media, and unfortunately, scientists tend to glom onto it.   Disorder implies the opposite of order… and entropy is neither.  Entropy is the tendency for ENERGY to DISPERSE.   That’s it.   Energy wants to disperse at a maximal rate.   And if more energy can disperse thru an emergent order, then Entropy will favor the emergence of order. More complex molecules form from atoms because the molecule has a lower energy state and heat is released- i.e. Energy disperses.  Convective loops form because they disperse energy more efficiently. And  Living systems disperse energy faster than non-living systems, so entropy favors the emergence of order when order disperses more energy than disorder.  The coining of disorder came from the observation that two gasses in separate volumes would MIX, but that a mixed gas would not UNMIX. And the Unmixed arrangement was characterized as being More ‘ordered’.    Its not.  Its literally artificially ordered.  And mixed gasses DO unmix in a high enough gravitational gradient by mass alone.   Gravity acts to pull mass together, concentrating energy. And entropy acts to disperse energy, and the interplay of the two results in emergent order.

5 + 5 =/= 10
Basically when you take a mechanism with 5 parameters and combine it with another mechanism with 5 parameters, the outcome complex mechanism will have much more than 10 parameters that need to be taken into consideration.

The clapping example isn't an example of a phase transition (or bifurcation as we'd call it). It's an example of transients dying out to reveal some underlying stable behavior. It would be a phase transition if the coupling between the audience members changed somehow. Also, the Kuramoto model is valid close to a particular phase transition called a Hopf bifurcation, so the model is a special case of more general coupling theory. In the Kuramoto model, stronger coupling implies synchrony, but stronger coupling is not sufficient for synchrony in general. Source: I specialize in coupled oscillator theory. As part of my work I'm developing methods to understand how coupled BZ reactors change in phase-locking behavior as a function of coupling strength.

Great video. I was working in London when the bridge opened, and tried it. You could see, or more accurately, feel, the positive feedback loop of people walking in step applying more energy into the swing. I tried walking out of time and nearly fell over; you subconsciously timed your steps so that you put your foot down at the end of each swing when the bridge briefly stopped moving.

I had assumed that the initial oscillation was caused specifically by the low vertical profile of the suspension, but I think the video is saying that it's the fact the suspension cable curve has a horizontal element, and it's the lateral pressure applied on this by the footsteps that caused the problem.

Anyway, the bridge now has no wobble, which in a way is a shame even though it was impractical to keep it as it was.

From science we learn more and more that our existence in the Universe is not at all like we (or rather, most of us) assumed, that we were special, that our planet was special, that our solar system was special, and so on.

It thus doesn't seem so far fetched to me that the political polarization we see today has some of the same mathematical features as does the synchronization we see in nature. At least, polarization certainly looks like synchronization.

I'd guess that key components of "Polarization Mathematics" would be K, the coupling constant; i.e., the feelings of likeness/comradery among individuals as part of the us/them instinct, the neuro-circuitry in the brain and its electrical characteristics, and the electronic technologies by which people communicate, which are essentially extensions of our brain circuitry into the physical world. We are constantly building into the world that what it takes to be human. Examples are wheels for legs, telephone wires for nerve axons, electronic circuitry for neural circuits, TV cameras for eyeballs, etc.

I don't think humans have sufficient understanding of those key components for the task at hand, and so we're probably nowhere near such a mathematical theory, but I'd bet some mathematicians are toying with the idea.

"Owing to the loss of the capacity to ponder and reflect, whenever the contemporary average man hears or employs in conversation any word with which he is familiar only by its consonance, he does not pause to think, nor does there even arise in him any question as to what exactly is meant by this word, he having already decided, once and for all, both that he knows it and that others know it too.

A question, perhaps, does sometimes arise in him when
he hears an entirely unfamiliar word the first time; but in
this case he is content merely to substitute for the unfamiliar word another suitable word of familiar consonance
and then to imagine that he has understood it.
To bring home what has just been said, an excellent
example is provided by the word so often used by every
contemporary man—”world.(or perhaps "the universe")”

word and know how to probe them to find just what they
understand by it, they will at first be plainly as is said,
“embarrassed,” but quickly pulling themselves together,
that is to say, quickly deceiving themselves, and recalling
the first definition of the word that comes to mind, they
will then offer it as their own, although, in fact, they had
not thought of it before.

group of contemporary people, even from among those

would all so “beat about the bush” that involuntarily one
would recall even castor oil with a certain tenderness."

The donor heart is kept "alive" via electrical impulses until the time for its placement in the recipient . The recipients (failing) heart is kept "alive" by, well, by the recipient. This is a well recognized phenomena among cardiac surgeons.

A complementary explanation for one metronome A catching up with and so synchronizing with its neighbor B is that the extra motion imparted to the platform by A forces B to stay at the extremity of its swing for just slightly longer than it would otherwise have done, giving A time to complete its own swing as well. So effectively one slows the other down, rather than speeds it up as is shown in the vid at 5:47.

15:18 when people are walking that close together, they usually look downwards to see where the legs of the person in front of them are, so they won't kick or step on them. This causes people to take steps in sync with the person in front of them. When a person in front of you steps forward with their right leg, their left leg is left behind and will be in your way if you try to step forward with your left leg. So you will decide to step forward with your left leg when the person in front of you steps forward with their left leg so you can walk at the same speed without kicking them

Very interesting video, but there's a bug :
When you tell us about this spectacle in Budapest in which everybody applause at the same time, this is not a spontaneous fortuity happening .
At the end of opera, theatre, classical concerts or spectacles, it is in use in Europe that when people loved the show, the clap their hands at the same frequency after the artists had salute their public to ask them to come back .
If it's a concert, most of the times the musicians come back and sing another song . If it's an opera, the dancers and singers come back to salute their public once again .
Sometimes the public do it again and again, and some times the artist accept to play this "game" .
In French it's called: "un rappel", which means "a calling back" .
Opera singers are proud to say that they had 2, 3 or more "rappels" because that means that specators really loved their performance very much .
As you can see this synchronization is spontaneous, but it's a comon code that all spectators know, nothing to do with spontaneous fortuity .

This video fails to explain why two coupled pendula swing in sync. And it has nothing to do with an audience clapping in sync.   The explanation is the second law of thermodynamics.    A physical system excited away from equilibrium seeks to dissipate its excess energy as quickly as possible to reach equilibrium.  Two pendula swinging dissipate their energy of motion faster when they swing in sync because their synchronized motion excites motion of the support structure that couples them.  An oscillationg support structure, plus two synced pendula dissipates energy faster than two uncoupled pendula and a stationary support structure.

Two distinctions must be made: is a thing animate or an inanimate non-living being.  The other distinction depends on whether the "whole" of which you are speaking is a singular, organic, thus an animate whole in se, or is it merely a discrete whole, as, e.g., a bag/bridge full of people, or a bag of atoms of a particular inanimate element, each  a whole unto itself according as the "kind" of thing that it is, exhibiting its properties according to its nature.   The parts of a living being, for example, taken alone, cannot even exist without the whole having been posited in existence to begin with.  So, in this case, the whole is "more", or "greater", if you will, than any of the parts taken alone, which, as I said would not even have itself as a kidney or kidney cell, or a singular blood cell, or any other part.  For left "alone", outside of its organic wholeness, these parts will begin to decompose into distinct elemental things having themselves differently than when the life principle was present and maintaining the whole as a whole living thing...not a pile of non living elements. The life principle explains each of the parts, whether still part of the vivified whole or not;  the parts do not explain the whole; they are there by natural necessity, flowing from the thing's nature. Inanimate things, those things which do not have living principles, but inert, or inanimate, e.g., a bag of silver atoms; the quantity of atoms in the bag, however is only accidental....each is still an atom of silver neither greater or lesser in nature, each atom is a silver atom.  So I think you are asking the wrong question. Synchronicity is not a property, for property flows from a thing's nature. Synchronicity, in other words is not part of the nature of any whole; it does not explain an thing's nature, or any of a whole thing's parts....it is what Aristotle/Aquinas referred to as pure "accidents". You and I may not be the same height, weight, complexion, standing, sitting, or what have you, which do not explain our nature. More than one human being on a foot-bridge does not change any human being's nature and thus the properties which flow from that nature which is essence "in act". So, again, properties flow from a thing's nature, its essence, necessarily, essence being that which makes a thing the kind of thing that it is.

Needless to say, I obviously couldn't do it. this is way too far ahead in technological advances, into the realm of sci-fi, and WAY TOO FAR out of my mental league - and likely incorrect anyway - but my little 15 year old self gave herself headaches trying to figure it out. And I never forgot those experiments. I use this "Fake science" as fact in my sci-fi novel, because it's my universe, and I can. :) Might as well use it somewhere.

I guess my science class's involvement in the Marsville project gave me the idea that I could do this. (I was part of the water reclamation team. We found multiple ways of getting water to our Martian colony that included working with hydroponics, and waste management. I know. Ew. We were all 13 and 14 year olds. We set up the fake colony on an air force base, which always made me wonder if they were watching us, took some of our more salient ideas, and expanded on them. We were all kids, but kids tend to have the most vivid imaginations that aren't heavily blocked by internal criticism, or a heavy logic filter. Their ideas might sound crazy, but sometimes there's a nugget of brilliance in them. ...And sometimes they're just nuts. :) )

I may suck at basic algebra, and couldn't solve a scientific problem to save my life, but science is cool, and I still want to know why things are the way they are.

Funny Mr. Prof, your analogy with sympathetic runners did not seem strong for me UNTIL you started to at the end discuss the immune system (i.e., infectious disease spread) and the economy.  I will state quite plainly that what you have in nearly all of these phenomenon is a localized minimum of potential.  It is not quite the same as entropy.  Entropy is merely a state in which things nicely space out to the point at which those localized disturbances in potential disappear.  So think of it like this, why doesn't ALL water drain into the same "lowest" Ocean?  The answer is that there are localized barriers where addition of energy would be required to pass over and then flow down to the global lowest potential Ocean.  That is why we have lakes and puddles.  But these are cases of static barriers.  What happens with these complex systems is that you are dealing with dynamic barriers that tend to oscillate over time.  It is one of the reasons that string theory is so good at mathematically modeling stuff - because every string has an inherent resonant frequency as a property of it's length and it's terminus states.  BUT in the case of these systems, the energy required to maintain the status quo (Newton's law) is always REDUCED by acting in synchrony.  At a mechanical level, it is gross physical forces as you say with the pendulums.  But in the case of the people walking on the bridge, it is also that they can maintain the status quo (remaining upright) with less energy by counter-acting the lateral sway with a wider stance, thus imparting more lateral forces into the bridge with each step.  This may, in fact, be the key to understanding the constant speed of EM energy which travels as "waves", i.e., oscillating particles.   Getting back to that example I didn't like about the runner on the track, when you recognize that for many (not all) people, maintaining pace is not a costless process, then by linking pace to someone else's pace, you gain back that energy that was previously being diverted from the act of running to the act of pace tracking and maintenance and that can now lead to more efficient running.  In the example of an economy, that could be an explanation to why markets move in seemingly non-random ways.  Rather than expend energy into deciphering oceans of financial statements, isn't it just simpler to follow a trend or listen to the analyst recomendation.  Even though rational people who understand information pricing theory should NOT do that!  And with respect to infectious diseases coming in wave after wave, it is the same kind of thing - assessing risk directly and individually costs too much on the phsyche so that the society is prone to act in concert in ways that will lead to oscillation (the expert says it's safe, so everybody goes out and more infections happen... then the expert says it's not safe so everybody stays home and infections drop). strings also "synchronises" themselves :
we call Sympathics strings a string not meant to be played directly by a musician, but to resonate accordingly to an other one.

Here is the fun thing : a sympathic string will not play a note if its not an harmonic of the original one.
Because the string have a length, and have more or less tension in it, it cannot vibrate if not in certain frequences.

for example : an A string vibrate an will always vibrate at 440hz. This frequences have harmonics in D and F,.
So, a sympathic string in C' will not vibrate if i play the A one, because it will not be put in the good motion to be audible.

however, if you tap the back of a guitar, every string will vibrate and produce an audible sound :
a suffisant amount of force will put the strings in an audible motion, wathever the frequence/ note of the string.

So, a sympathic string does not move because of the forces around her when she vibrates due to an other one.
It's solely the harmonic resonation amplified by the synchronisation of the string.

About understanding the whole on basis of its parts; I think I got half the answer: you don't. It's like expecting to understand the universe in its entirety but still differentiating between its (perceived) parts. If you want to observe a "complex system" in its entirety you shouldn't look at it as different parts working together or as a "complex system" but without preconceived ideas how things work. Just observe. It's very hard to do for an adult that has already "learned" all those ideas about how things work. So the first step would be to understand that the universe really is one thing, it's really everything. If you have no concept of boundaries within the universe you could theoretically understand it, I guess. You would only see "everything". It's mind bending to think about it and probably doesn't help anyone but I believe that we might as well give up as nobody will ever understand a " complex system" in its entirety, at the very least not the way we are today. Also it would change everything about human life so we should also be careful and ask ourselves: do we really have to know everything?

Some of the explanations appear to be flawed to me. For instance, in order for synchronization to occur, conditions must for be met. The most apparent condition is that the items in question must be linked to the same base and the base must not be stationary. It appears that the laws of inertia are at play here rather than any natural synchronization (concerning the clock and metronomes).

Additionally, many of the analogies or examples given are not accurate as water does NOT freeze at one time but rather molecules freeze gradually and independent of one another. Consider you put a bottle of water in the freezer, then take it out to examine it in set intervals of time, you will find that parts of the water bottle will freeze before the whole bottle is frozen. Again, a pseudo-law of physical change is occurring. I would characterize it as a domino effect.

The audience clapping is not a sample of synchronization. The demonstration here is of a European audience. Having lived in Europe as a professional music conductor, I've experienced hundreds of audience ovations and the "Synchronized" clapping is actually a European custom when clapping. It's the same for large audiences and even small groups in a home. In the USA, it is not a custom and synchronization is rarely done. It's not a US "thang". It is a European "Thang". People do not respond through collective mathematical influence. They respond at a customary point in time from 'the few' and the sync. is quickly mimicked through the audience from an aural  trigger.

As a Hungarian, this clapping Synchronization is still usual, it happens after almost every performances with an audience (but most common in theater). For a long time i thought it happens in every crowd in every culture, turns out its kind of unique to Hungary. Its a cultural thing. I've learned it not long ago that its a habit that goes back to the communist era, when the "good comrades" wanted the claps to keep going, given it was most likely after a play that praised the communist regime. So they found out that this was the best way to elongate clapping and cheering. It spontaneously synchronizes at a slow pace, speeds up until people can't keep the tempo together, goes into chaos, and then starts again. We call it "vastaps" which mirror translates to "iron-applause", how ironic (pun) because we were behind the iron curtain at the time LOL. Its a cultural thing, but it works because of the principle you discuss here.

Great video but... The very first sentence reiterates a very common fallacy.

"The Second Law of Thermodynamics tells us that everything in the Universe tends towards disorder."

That is not true.

The Second Law tells us that there is a natural tendency for energy concentrations to spread out unless they are constrained in some way.

The entropy of "everything in the Universe" does not always increase. That only happens in closed systems. Open systems, like planet Earth can contain components that go the other way. Lifeforms represent sublimely magnificent "order" that increases as organisms develop. That does not violate the correct statement of the Second Law. "Order" is a human perception that has no formal definition in science and it should not be used in any statement of the second law.

So, again, nobody told them to applaude in sync, but I think there's still a cultural reason, rather than a physical/chemical reason

Prof. Steven Strogatz is an idiot. His analogy with "friends who run around a track and adjust speed to each other out of sympathy" is stupid because neither emotions nor intellect has anything to do with synchronizing metronomes. The correct explanation is much simpler: Each metronome has a potential energy defined by its current position angle ("phase"). The metronomes transfer their potential energy towards the movable supporting bar which connects them, and that bar distributes that energy to all metronomes, thereby causing synchronization of phases.

His claim, "You might think, if you increase the coupling you gradually get the metronomes more and more synchronized: That is not what happens" is false, too. The coupling of the metronomes that stand on a bar of wood is achieved by transferring energy via friction between the bottom surface of the metronome and the wood bar. If the friction coefficient between these surfaces were zero, there would be no coupling and the metronomes would not synchronize. The higher the friction coefficient is, the faster the synchronization happens.

His comparison with freezing of water is also stupid, because the coupling mechanism of friction has nothing to do with water's phase change from fluid to solid.

The comparison with a clapping audience is also stupid, because metronomes are not intelligent beings which can synchronize at will. The same is true for comparisons with animals.

To be fair, the 2nd law of Thermodynamics was written in the 19th century as scientists and observers were trying to describe the operation of steam engines in a theoretical way. It states simply that a closed system will lose energy until it achieves equilibrium with the environment. Essentially, you can't build a steam engine that turns all its heat into work. Some of the heat must be lost to the environment until all the heat is gone. Entropy was a concept devised to quantify that energy loss. Entropy has gone on to become a far more abstract notion of order devolving into disorder, but it comes from those thermodynamic roots.

That said, the pedestrians producing bridge sway is more a proof of the 2nd law than a refutation. All that walking is, after all, adding tremendous energy to the system. Again, the metronomes will also prove the 2nd law in that they will eventually run out of energy and come to rest. While synchronicity is interesting, it doesn't cause any problems for entropy. Still, that doesn't make the video any less interesting.

I love your vids, rly entertaining and instructive vids, but I want to say that I think in the claps clip is not that synchronization you are talking about, but if I think about it this is also a synchronization on its way. I mean this is a tradition in Hungary that at the end of the theater play or any kind of a performance (like music) when you know the curtain falls we just start clapping and after a while the performers come out to the stage and when they go back somebody starts this rythm ta-ta ta-ta ..., so we expressively say by clapping that we want to see them once more, so "come out again" (in hungarian "vi-ssza"), sometimes we clapping and saying it at the same time and sometimes just clapping.
So long story short here this is just a traditionally message or more like a (nonverbal) code to the performers we appreciate them.
Cheers

The notion of the moon “rotating about its axis” has bugged me for a while and I think it comes down to the definition of rotation.  When viewed from a fixed Newtonian frame of reference, as in your animation,  an observer sees all sides of the moon, hence you could say it’s rotating.  But it’s not rotating about its own axis.  Once the moon has been tidally locked, it no longer rotates about its axis.  The analogy would be the pedal on a bike where the pedal is the moon and the center of the crank is earth.  If you held the pedal and did one full rotation the pedal would rotate about its axis and the “earth” would see all sides of the crank.   But an observer in the room would only see one side of the crank.  If instead you did not touch the pedal but rotated the crank one revolution, the pedal would clearly not rotate about its axis and the “earth” would only see one side of the pedal...but someone standing in the room would see all sides of the pedal and hence say that it was “rotating”.

The synchronized clapping sample is somewhat erroneous.  People consciously adjust clapping based on mental influences, such as to keep tempo with a band playing music.  If people were to naturally start clapping in unison it would seem so odd that they would likely adjust their clapping to be out of sync.  Unless, of course, they were keeping time with music or some form of ritual chant.  But then their synchronized clapping would be a conscious decision, not a natural phenomenon.

This is common knowledge to those EE's who have designed all kinds of programmable oscillators with a limited Capture Range that depends on the Q of the resonator Q=fo/BW (-3dB ).

Remember old TV's with Horizontal and vertical sync? There are other factors like Barhausen Criterion (Loop gain must =>+1) It also depends on phase compensation and phase/gain margin .

Old TV CRT's worked with manual tuning the flyback oscillator so that it synced up to the TV signals. This was an injection locked loop (ILL) like the pendulums. Then came stable crystal oscillators were used with Phase Locked Loops (PLL) with phase mixers and filters. The internet and telephony uses Stratum 1 to 3 synchronized clocks all synchronized to a Cesium global clock. Then there are ATM's that are pleisiochronous or "almost" synchronous.

The formula for this capture range is nonlinear partly from positive feedback and because of the Barkhausen criteria where damped oscillations may get amplified to sustain oscillations such that the loop gain must be >=+1 After which soft limiting stress keeps it a more or less sine wave and dampens the oscillation to be steady like the Wein (Wien?) Oscillator.

The harmonic content of bridge failures is because Civil engineers didn't understand what EE's already knew about harmonic content (THD) and intermodulation (IM) distortion, where nonlinear materials create sub-harmonic (sum and ) difference frequencies. This is fundamental to all radio design. (no pun intended).

This is a case of a breakdown in language. When we speak of order in the second law of thermodynamics it has nothing to do with synchronisation.

Order actually has two meanings let's call them order1 and order2.

Order1 means repetition in a regular way. So if marbles are stacked neatly then they are in order. This is what we usually mean when we say order in every day use.

Order2 has a very different meaning. An example of order2 would be language, so any sentence or paragraph etc. That you read that would be order2. If there was a mistake in the sentence then there would be less order2, the more mistakes the less order2 there would be in that sentence. Order2 is synonymous with functionality This is what we mean when we use the term order in entropy.

Let's look at the relationship between order1, order2 and chaos.

The more randomness you add into a sentence the less order2 you have but the more repetition you have in a sentence the less order2 you have also. At the same time the more repetition you have the more order1 you have in a sentence.

A well written computer program will have high order2 and almost zero chaos and very little order1.

Any object or unit of information will have some mix of these three elements, order1, order2 and chaos.

Any functional item will be very high on order2. Any rhythm is very high on order1. The weather is an example of something high on chaos.

So an increase in order1 (what we would consider order like taking the letters of a sentence and putting them in alphabetical order) is actually a decrease in order2 (i.e. the functional meaning of the sentence disappears) which is the order we are talking about in the second law of thermodynamics.

The discussion about the 2 clocks “synchronizing” 180 out of phase (3:00 thru 4:30) reminded me of something I witnessed a few years ago. Two of my grandsons (roughly aged 3 and 4 years old) somehow managed to wrestle two 6’ stepladders onto a trampoline. When I stumbled upon the scene they were both 1/2 way up their stepladders and bouncing on the trampoline 180 degrees out of phase (when one was highest in the air the other was lowest on the trampolines downward stretch). As dangerous as it appeared, it was at the same time fascinating. I can’t help but think that somehow they managed, without thinking about it, the same kind of synchronous movement achieved by the two pendulum clocks. I didn’t want to startle them and calmly asked them to stop. I was equally amazed when they managed to stop, climb off the ladders and make their way to the ground without falling. I was relieved and proud all at the same time. 😊🤷‍♂️ Now 17 and 18 years old, neither has any memory of it.

Synchronized clapping in classical concerts is not an instance of the physical phenomenon, it is a matter of taste and expression of musical beings.  It is voluntary, not emergent. Clapping in phase means we want an encore. In Brazil and possibly elsewhere a pianist will give an encore immediately if the audience asks in this way. When I do want a bis, I listen to the clapping and find the pulse. It’s intentional.

Two pedantic notes from a retired electrical engineer:
[1] The bridge sync is like any system that has a resonance (and there may be more than one resonant frequency in a system). Electrical engineers routines apply "white noise" (randomness) to a resonant system to determine its resonant frequency(s).
[2] When two timing sources are "close" in frequency, then something called a "beat" frequency results from the difference between the two frequencies. For example, if one is 0.1% different from the other (i.e. "close"), then there should be one "beat" every 1000 cycles. If 0.01% apart, then 10000, etc. Now if that frequency is from something slow, like a metronome or pendulum, say 1/sec, then you would have to wait 10000 sec (about 2.8 hours) before they sync, but only "momentarily", before they start to drift away. Then there's the "anti-beat" when they're motions are synced oppositely, at half the time, but repeats at the same frequency of once/2.8 hr. Now that also assumes that these are perfect timing systems with no animalities to throw a stick into the spokes, otherwise, more chaos ensues. Now multiply that to say 50 metronomes. The math gets more sticky, like the complexities of the 2-body vs. 3-body (or more) celestial orbital equations. But then computers were made to simulate is stuff so we humans can stay (mostly) sane.
And this shouldn't detract from any enjoyment of the simplicity of the world around us, just know that it's there and the engineers (mostly) know how to address any issues that come along (albeit, after the fact sometimes).

Maybe I'm a physics savant, who just never studied physics. Or maybe Huygens had an off day at work :P

Edit: Seriously, how do people not immediately just see how this works? What causes the effect? I am starting to think I've wasted my youth in the wrong career.

No need for fancy explanations. The more a pendulum moves on an angle to gravity, the more it pulls whatever it is tethered to out of place. Simple so far, right? One could delve into it, but I think most who have used a swing can intuit it. When a swing is at the top, it can pull the whole swing frame out of place. Okay... So when a swing is at the top, it transfers energy to the frame it is tethered to. The frame then shifts perpendicularly to the ground. The shifting frame will transfer energy to other pendulums attached to it. The more parallelly to the ground a pendulum is moving, the more of the energy that the beam transfers to it results in movement because the frame is moving completely parallelly to the ground. If the pendulum is moving at 45 degrees to the ground, half of the energy transferred to it will be directed towards the ground, and just result in friction. The other half will result in movement along the axis that the pendulum is moving.

The frame transfers energy from pendulums moving perpendicularly to the ground to pendulums moving parallelly to the ground. The more perpendicular and parallel the motions are, the greater the effect. So energy is transferred until the pendulums are in sync.

The pendulums don't even have to be influencing the frame they are attached to to sync up. It is enough that the frame is moving fairly rhythmically, like from wind or waves. Pretty sure that is by far the biggest factor for pendulums on ships, for instance.

"It was only a few decades ago that scientists started fleshing out a rigorous theory of synchronization."  I don't believe that because it seems too easy.  Framework of proof (for pendulums on a common movable platform, but this can easily be generalized):  (1) Assuming there were 1 pendulum only, express the effect of the movement of the 1 pendulum on the movement of the platform.  (2) Express effect of the movement of n asynchronous pendulums on the movement of the platform.  (3) Express the effect of the movement of the platform on the movement of a pendulum.  (4) From 2 and 3, generate a system of equations for the cases with 1 and 2 pendulums.  (5) Solve for the equilibrium in a case with 1 and 2 pendulums, with arbitrary starting values.  (6) Show that the equilibrium does not change if you add 1 pendulum, regardless of the current number of pendulums.  Alternate proof framework:  (1) Prove that regardless of current state after one period an apparatus with 2 pendulums is closer to synchronous equilibrium by more than some fraction of the present distance to the synchronous equilibrium.  (2) Prove that for an arbitrary number of pendulums by induction.  (3) Prove that the sequence of distance to synchronous equilibrium indexed by period asymptotes to the 0.

the second law of thermodynamics is actually perfectly congruent with spontaneous synchronization. all it says is that an action must decrease the free energy of a system in order for it to be spontaneous (i.e. allowed to happen). burning a fire is spontaneous, because you can exploit the temperature gradient between the fire and its surroundings to transfer energy and do useful work- that’s how a generator works. by the same logic, synchronization is spontaneous because you could theoretically use a machine to extract the energy in the phase difference in order to produce useful work.

at one point you even compare a synchronized system to a crystal. that actually demonstrates the second law of thermodynamics perfectly- a perfect crystal is perfectly homogenous, therefore there are no gradients to extract energy from.

The 2ond law of thermodynamics does NOT state that things move from order to chaos. The 2ond law states specifically that energy moves from high concentration to low concentration. If you think about it in terms of heat (which is what thermodynamics is about), high energy particles (e.g. steam) behave very chaotically while low energy particles (e.g. ice) sit around being very orderly. Thus, in a larger sense, things move not from order to chaos but from useful chaos (high concentration) to useless order (low concentration). The heat death of the universe won't be mass chaos, it'll be perfect order where there is no differentiation between any part of space and identical particles are evenly distributed through out the universe. In comparison, the big bang was total chaos. The popular misconception that the 2ond law states that things move from order to chaos is just that, a misconception. You don't need to look far to realize that it is a misconception.

Im no scientists, and this is just my brain going off on a tangent, but.... To understand the complex whole, perhaps instead of putting it back together in its entirety, we should see how it interacts in parts.

As said, to understand how X works, science breaks it into smaller parts, for example: A B C and D. Then we figure out how these work by themselves.

Now lets assume we figured out how these work on their own, but when we put them back together the result baffles us still, would not the logical next step be to first see how these singulair parts interact with eacother individually?

How do A and B interact. How do A and C interact. A and D. B and C. And so on and so forth. Once we know how A and B interact, we introduce C into the mix, and see how A, B and C interact together, and wether or not this somehow influences or even changes the function of A, B or both or all.

Once we understand all the various different interactions, perhaps the whole will finally make sense.

We've seen this same (destructive) self-synchronizing behavior in network protocols. And this applies over many orders of magnitude of time/frequency. Back when Ethernet was half-duplex and relied in collision detection and back-off for retransmission, the spec says you need to do exponentially increasing back-off.. but with a randomized component since other stations in the same ethernet collision domain were also doing the same thing. You didn't want to have perfectly synchronized retransmissions by all the stations waiting just dozens of microseconds later. Same applies to routing protocols that send updates on the order of tens of seconds; many of these have flooding behavior, but you want to add a randomized component to the timers to avoid synchronized updates. It's a common practice these days, though something to behold back when that was learned the hard way.

Also I've noticed the more a group of individuals that have trained in a synchronized activity, the quicker they 'fall into line' than they would before being trained. Eg. After almost finishing my basic Army training, we (my colleagues and I) were sent out off base on leave to go buy a bunch of stuff. When we walked up the street, the locals and even each other could notice our association as non-locals by the marching 'in-step' drill that had been burnt into our brain by strenuous repetition. So in only a few steps, completely unintentionally, we (say a group of 10) would naturally all be 'in-step' with everyone's left leg stepping altogether followed by the right in perfect cadence. It was a main reason why one of our weekend leave conditions were not to walk together in more than 3 or 4 person groups. You'll be surprised  how intimidating a group people just walking together with a trained synchronized reinforcement can appear to regular civilians. It kind of subconsciously triggers people's primitive Fight-Flight-or-Freeze responce as your subconscious side of your brain runs the numbers on the size and possible threat of the new, possibly dangerous unknown 'tribe'. But the other side of the coin is also true, if you're apart of that 'tribe', you naturally feel comfortable and protected on a primitive level, being able to relax the constant primitive alertness down a few pegs. It's the same reason behind why you get that euphoric feeling when you're together with a bunch of friends

This may only be partially related to the video, but I'd like to make a comment on the statement that the moon rotates on its axis. I've spend a lot of time arguing with virtually all my friends that the fact that we only see one side of the moon supports (proves) the thesis that the moon does NOT rotate on its axis. Think about it as a hammer which an athlete swings around themselves - there's literally no axis you can spin the ball around, which would not cause the chain to swirl around itself or the ball, even if you use the one that begins at the point where the ball and the chain are attached. I don't of course object to the fact that the moon is rotating, relative to the rest of the objects in space, but that rotation is only defined by the motion of the moon through space and not around its axis. What I am trying to say is that it actually rotates around the Earth's center, for the reasons described in the video.

The discussions I mentioned were terminated, because they always became circular with no agreement ever reached. My friends always appealed to authority, which as suggested in the video always supported their statement. But what is authorities are wrong?

In the end it seems like the argument comes down to the definition of what rotation around the axis is, but is there actually a point to argue about in this definition? What strikes me more than my friends refusing to see my argumented point is that when I took the question to older people, they were supportive of my point of view. I clearly remember that we were taught in school (Bulgaria during the 90s) that the Earth rotates around its axis while the moon does not. So I wonder at what point in time things changed and how this happened towards the thesis that is disproved so easily.

This video also explained what is the meaning of the selection "Enable/disable spread spectrum" in the BIOS/UEFI setup of personal computers. By default that is enabled since most people don't understand its meaning. Spread spectrum forces the CPU clock speed to vary slightly which prevents a group of similar computers in a same room to start to oscillate together. However, overclockers often disable spread spectrum since it might improve the overclocking capability of the CPU.

I would imagine that the complexity of the "whole" does not scale linearly with increasing the number of parts. I've observed synchronization in organ pipes.  If you get two pipes almost in tune they sometimes pull each other in tune.  The same pipes in combinations with other pipes may not be close enough to pull each other in tune.  Synchronization is an advantage of slider chests, in which several pipes on the same note are connected by one channel that supplies air to them.  This close physical connection helps them to synchronize their sound waves.

This explains how generators on the electrical grid stay synchronized.  Without synchronization the grid would be a massive short circuit and all the generators would go up in smoke.  However, if you accidentally connect a portable generator to the grid it will not likely synchronize, and it will burn up immediately.  I've seen the results on a few portable generators.

A clock multiplier (like what's inside your CPU, allowing it to tick at 2-4 GHz in spite of having a reference clock about an order of magnitude slower than that) follows the same exact principles!

To generate a clock signal that's, say, 8x as fast as a reference, connect an adjustable oscillator's output to a 1/8 clock divider. Compare the divided signal against the reference signal and adjust the oscillator's speed a little bit each tick. Once the reference clock and 1/8 divided clock are in step, your undivided clock is exactly 8x as fast as the reference. (Engineers call this a "phase-locked loop" or "PLL")

Here's a very long reply. Great video at first, but not after watching it. First, it seems way too convoluted and misleading. Each metronome has a weight and a force sharing the same material they are standing on, hence transfering some of their momentum with each other and so they are "kicking against" other metronomes that are not synced and so the fewer/smaller/lighter and/or out of synced ones will be kicked until they stand in line, reaching equillibrium, which this basically the focus of this video. Equilibrium. Different forces pushing against each other until they all "agree". That should be the whole video...

But it's not. Again, it's really simple, but this video makes it way overly compex and even mystical with the long format and music. And the claps in the theathre example a something entirely different phenomenon; as in that case the 'metronomes' (people) are changing their rythm on their own free will based on not just hearing others, but expecting (and adjusting to the) 'expected/calculated to be agreed upon' rythm. There are no physichal forces present (yeah, sound pressure, bla bla) but they have intelligence and choice there. So yeah, it's a crap example by all means.

Moving on, many examples are trying to justify, even mystify this simple physics-based, logical, calculated interaction with something like the highest common denominator. For an educational video, it fails spectacularly.

Let's take that bridge with say 300 people on it stepping completely randomly. No movement at all. But even if let's say 10 (or even 2) people starts stepping at the same time (synchronized), they are already generating a force that is affecting every other people on that bridge. And when the number of people reaches critical mass, even neutral people are become part of the wobble if they don't forcefully move against it and just "go with the flow".

And once the bridge is wobbling, it makes it much simpler to walk in a way that's aligned with others than it is to try to break stride (sync) as it means less force to do so.

But where I really lost is was yout line of "it wasn't people walking in sync that got the bridge to wobble, it was the wobbling bridge that got people to walk in sync" is completely garbage! It's not a chicken or the egg debacle, it's a simple cause and effect solution! That bridge without people would not have wobbled at all! It was the few initial people (in sync) starting the wobble while others followed them and their sync by doing just as little as not moving against them! Because it's much easier physcally to lean into a force than to go against it (hence the positive feedback loop), which is what made the whole bridge wobble. And even if someone isn't moving, their body is just "dead weight" adding to the wobble, as the human body is much more 'jiggly' than concrete.

It's all simple physics and math, yet you managed to blow this up with tons of irrelevant, even incorrect examples and "answers" and even mystifing the whole thing.

Bonus: The ship example is also completely irrelevant and the sentece of "A moon starts out with its own gravitational frequency" was just also a ridiculousl oversimplification.

For an educational video, this is all unacceptable. Order is simply stuff we understand and disorder doesn't exist, it just means stuff we've yet to understand.

We used to do this when I was a kid on a bridge we called the Swinging Bridge.  It only took one person to stand in the center of the suspension bridge and get it to start swinging.  If we put two people on it we could get it to swing at a greater amplitude.  Soon we could hardly walk off of the bridge since we were walking in step with the natural frequency of the bridge and the mass of the walkway was so large that we could hardly get it to stop.  So what came first the chicken or the egg?  Well on some days when the wind was blowing hard enough and just the right angle the bridge would be swinging on its own.  No people on it at all.  In the winter if the bridge was icy and had more mass it would not swing.  Maybe we did not have enough kids to overcome the at rest mass of the bridge but I'm just glad it did not fall into the river some 12 feet below.  Then we would have some "splainin to do Lucy."

I am an avid follower of your videos. In this particular case, I do not believe all of the examples provided fall into the same category of synchrony. The example of the metronomes results from physical properties of motion, where the moveable base influences the pendulum's velocity or swing distance over time. The fireflies are an example akin to geese taking on a formation upon leaving the surface of a lake. Rules are involved in the sequencing of the geese or the firing of the flies, which may not appear capable of producing the synchrony, but which nonetheless result in a self-organizing system. There is no "physical property" required for the fireflies except the simple rule that individual flies begin synchronizing with other individuals in close proximity. The synchrony requires a certain amount of time to take shape, but there are agents--the flies, or the geese, etc., each of which only requires a very small number of rules to govern their behavior to permit the larger effect of the self-organizing group. With the metronomes, there are no agents that make adjustments. Rather, gravity/movement causes the variation of the pendulums' patterns, even if in barely discernible amounts on each swing.
The simultaneous applause is not at all an example of the natural examples of synchrony. This kind of applause is very common in Europe (I have never experienced it in America, but a friend of mine says she has). In Europe, it is a culturally defined behavior. People seek an encore from a soloist by permitting synchronous applause to be achieved. But any two or three people, able to clap loudly, are able to evoke this behavior. The alacrity with which it comes to be shows that people are responding to the auditory cues. There is nothing "self-organizing" about it. Try to bring this off in a hall where people are not aware of the semiotics of synchronous clapping and it will not take place (I've tried and failed). In Europe, once people begin to hear it, they immediately conform. In other words, the example is altogether unrelated to what is happening with the metronomes, though it is someone closer to the fireflies.
Perhaps you could reexamine the characteristics that relate to self-organizing systems in a future episode, making sure the phenomenology is uniform among the examples. Personally, I think Stephen Wolfram's examples of self-organizing automata offer concrete and visually compelling instances of this, while also permitting the effects of perturbations to be perceived. Thanks for your consideration.

The Second Law of Thermodynamics was never stated in so many words. It is based on a few facts. There can be no perfect insulator. There can be no perfect reflector. All potential energy eventually turns into heat. All energy is dissipated. So all systems tend to their lowest energy level. A pattern of hot and cold spots tends to become a large warmness.

So if in a system synchronous action would be the lower energy level then things will become synchronized. If in some system chaos produces a lower energy level then things will become chaotic.

Occam actually said, "Entitiies are not to be multiplied beyond necessity." He meant that when you see a new phenomenon you should try to explain it as an unusual combination of known causes rather than invent a new Force of Nature. A nitpick: the 2nd law is not about “disorder,” but rather is about “degrees of freedom.” As a system approaches equilibrium, states that have more degrees of freedom are exploited preferentially relative to those that have lesser degrees of freedom. (Heat is a form of energy that has tremendous degrees of freedom, which is why other forms of energy tend to dissipate as heat.)
Mind blown

The second law of thermodynamics establishes the concept of entropy as a physical property of a thermodynamic system. Entropy predicts the direction of spontaneous processes, and determines whether they are irreversible or impossible, despite obeying the requirement of conservation of energy, which is established in the first law of thermodynamics. The second law may be formulated by the observation that the entropy of isolated systems left to spontaneous evolution cannot decrease, as they always arrive at a state of thermodynamic equilibrium, where the entropy is highest. If all processes in the system are reversible, the entropy is constant.[1]

Yet another immensely fascinating video. I have been thinking a lot about how order spontaneously emerged in the Universe given the statistical tendency towards disorder, and you have provided me with an answer to my question (although I suspect there are more). I guess it really does come down to "ask, and you shall receive".

Mind you, my intuition screams that this is only a partial answer to that question, and that there are several other forces or phenomena at work which allow for the culmination of order within entropic systems. Essentially, I'm not convinced by the idea of inevitable heat death. Don't get me wrong, I understand the 2nd thermodynamic law reasonably well, if more as a statistical phenomenon than as a chemical one, and I can articulate the concept to others through a physical demonstration (using eggs and their case). However, my intuition refuses the leap between the likelihood of energy distribution becoming maximally equitable throughout a system, and the certainty that this will happen throughout our entire Universe. The claim seems to rest on too many assumptions, namely that the Universe behaves as a statistically probabilistic system when viewed from afar. But if this were so, I just can't see how such deep levels of complex order emerged in the first instance. My gut is saying someone has gone wrong somewhere, or missed something, and your insights help to fuel that fire in my gut, and give me confidence to pursue that curiosity intellectually.

I would also like to add how consistently fantastic your content is, and has always been, and how very deeply I admire you. Between you, Einstein, Michio Kaku, Musk, and Roger Penrose, I have found a deep love for physics and will do whatever it takes to study it at University. So thankyou so much for your content, and for enabling me to find something that I love. I have a little plastic ball with a white squiggle on it that I look at when I get occasionally down, and it reminds me that the world isn't so bleak, and that there are really great people out there doing very positive things in spite of it all. So thanks again. :)

I dislike the "disorder" comparison when talking about entropy.  Whenever there's a transfer of heat the amount of usable energy in a closed system goes down. Some coincidence to come across this video. Passionate about electronics. I enjoy creating circuits; including many available here on YouTube. I have many in opperation all across my bench top play area; laboratory.
For example a model radio transmission tower; flashing LED lights at top and mid sections.
Another circuit on the bench, a red and blue police flasher, alternatingly pulsing each color rapidly several times before changing from one to the alternate color.
These circuits all have different rates of timing.
I could not help but notice powering up the police flasher any flashing LED circuits that drew power from it's power sourse breadboard will eventually be flashing at the same rate regardless of it's design. Alone they have very diffrrent patterns; flash rates designed for a specific affect; very slow, very fast, and everything in between. Leave them alone and soon they are flashing in sync. Somewhat puzzling this phenomenon makes sense. I presume it has to do with the fluctuations in the power draw of the circuits. That is to say when a circuit A. for example is active there is less power available to the other circuits. When the circuit A. goes off between cycles there is a power surge. These rhythmic power fluctuations have to be the cause of the synchronizing. Just as my observation becomes more than a passing curiosity like some psychic phenomenon I get this Video randomly suggested by YouTube for my viewing pleasure.

The lesson on the bridge is, IMO, the entire problem of engineering. We stick these kids who have no working knowledge into school, pump them full of numerous bits of knowledge, then expect them to be able to put it all together in an adequate fashion. It's why the working class will always have an advantage. These lessons constantly make themselves evident when you always make tiny mistakes, so you learn the abstract faster as a result. When you always plan for every little thing, you end up over-exerting yourself before the more interesting problems, with accompanying all encompassing solutions, have even manifested; causing you to not actually learn anything truly revolutionary, and waste a lot of effort on easy fixes.

“The second law of thermodynamics tells us that everything in the universe tends towards disorder.” So why does any order exist at all? Why do atoms have specific energy signatures? Why do atoms combine and form complex molecules? Why do these molecules combine to form systems that perform functions? Why are there molecular machines that walk and build things and break things down and store things and create pulses of electrical current? Why did these molecules eventually group up to form organisms which hold the properties of “living”? Why did single-cell organisms eventually group up to form multicellular organisms. Why did these organisms evolve to have complex organ systems like digestive, musculoskeletal, circulatory, lymphatic, nervous, etc.? And I’m just thinking of humans but who knows what kind of crazy systems other life forms have (e.g. fungi). Why do creatures of similar traits group up and form teams and communities? Why is there such a thing as an ecosystem where everything has an effect on the environment but they all balance in such a way that the environment is maintained? Sometimes I’m surprised at our astonishment  towards phenomena such as synchrony when it seems that nature has always been this way? And why are we this way when the second law of thermodynamics tells us that everything in the universe tends towards disorder?

Such synchronization causes problems in computing.  When multiple apps (clients) are polling the same computer server, they tend to synchronize their requests creating a "thundering herd" where all clients request service at the same time, overwhelming the server.  The solution is to program in some small random variation (jitter) in the client polling interval.

) “Thank you, Falun Gong Master, for saving my family!” a man in Wuhan said to Ms. Xie, a Falun Gong practitioner, who had called his family earlier to offer help during the coronavirus epidemic.

Ms. Xie, a New York resident, started practicing Falun Gong in 2008, nine years after the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) started persecuting Falun Gong, also known as Falun Dafa. She soon called her friends and relatives in China to tell them that Falun Gong was nothing like what was being depicted by the CCP’s hate propaganda.

One of her friends, Ms. Hu, who lives in Wuhan, quit the CCP without any hesitation. When the two friends reconnected in 2020 amid the coronavirus epidemic, Ms. Hu's husband also quit the CCP and recovered from the coronavirus. Below is the story told by Ms. Hu.

“I Regret I Didn’t Quit the CCP Earlier!”
I called my friend Ms. Hu in Wuhan around 2008. She was very happy to hear from me. I told her about the CCP’s persecution of Falun Gong.

“Please help me quit the Communist Youth League, using my real name, so I will no longer have anything to do with the CCP,” she said to me joyfully. “I know you are kind to me. I trust my best friend!” I felt very happy for her.

I also talked to her husband and asked if he would like to quit the CCP. He said he didn’t like the CCP and was disgusted by it, but he didn’t want to quit.

When I heard the news about the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan earlier this year, I immediately called my friend to see if they were alright.

My friend wept on the other end of the line, “My husband is infected with the horrible virus. There are so many patients, and we cannot get him a hospital bed. He has to quarantine at home. His condition is getting worse…”

“Calm down and listen to me,” I said to her, “It's my fault that I didn't explain to your husband clearly enough about the importance of quitting the CCP back in 2008. If I had helped him quit the CCP then, he probably would not have been in such a situation today. May I speak with him?”

When her husband got on the phone, I explained to him in detail why people need to quit the CCP and its affiliated organizations. I also explained the ancient view of karmic connections between mankind’s wrongdoing and plagues, as well as stories of people recovering from the infection after breaking with the CCP.

He said, “Thank you! I really regret that I didn't listen to you earlier. Could you please help me quit the CCP now with my real name? Do I still have time to do this? I feel deep regret…” He spoke with a weak, but resolute, voice. He then broke down and cried.

I promised that I would help him quit the CCP. His 14-year-old daughter also asked me to help her quit the Young Pioneers using her real name.

“Thank you, Falun Gong Master, for Saving My Family!”
My friend told me that they were living in a small apartment with one bedroom and a lounge room. Her husband was quarantined in the bedroom and she and her daughter were sharing the lounge room.

“Many families who live in tight quarters like us have many members or the entire families infected or even perished. It's terrible and very sad. But I am still healthy even though I take care of my husband every day.”

I told her that she was protected after quitting the Communist Youth League.

“I'm so pleased I quit the CCP organization earlier! Thank you so much for helping me!”

I encouraged her to recite the auspicious phrases “Falun Dafa is good. Truthfulness-Compassion-Forbearance is good” so they would be blessed.

“We certainly will,” said my friend.

I called her again a week later. My friend told me excitedly, “It's truly amazing! My husband is fully recovered!”

Before I could say anything, her whole family started shouting loudly, “Falun Dafa is good! Truthfulness-Compassion-Forbearance is good!”

My friend's husband said emotionally, “I am 100% well now. Thank you! Thank you, Falun Gong Master for saving my family!”

I was also overwhelmed with happiness for them all!

19:25 Properties of the whole given the properties of the parts.
1 - The whole can be just a sperate container with its own properties.
2 - The whole can be made out of binding relationships between the parts.

Like a car. It moves you from point A to point B.
But, it's parts doesn't. The engine alone can't move you. The seat can't, Wheels can't.
The relationship between these parts created a whole with new properties.

We can break it down further, let's look at the engine as a whole. It consumes fuel, and produce dynamic energy.
But, it's part doesn't. A single cylinder can't produce dynamic energy, and it can't consume fuel.

The cylinder has it's own properties. like diameter, and manufacturing material.

The diameter of cylinder (alone) can't moves you from point A to point B, and can't produce dynamic energy.
